conclusion: Read the initial data from the v-t graph.
Bus: initial speed 30 m/s, comes to rest in 30 s (uniform deceleration).
Deceleration of bus a_b = 30 m/s / 30 s = 1.0 m/s².
Truck: initial speed 40 m/s, comes to rest in 20 s (uniform deceleration).
Deceleration of truck a_t = 40 m/s / 20 s = 2.0 m/s².
Displacement of bus from t = 0 to an arbitrary time t: s_b(t) = 30 t – ½(1.0)t².
Displacement of truck from t = 0 to an arbitrary time t: s_t(t) = 40 t – ½(2.0)t².
Separation as a function of time: Δ(t) = 30 m + s_b(t) – s_t(t) = 30 – 10 t + 0.5 t².
Differentiate and set dΔ/dt = 0 to find maximum separation: dΔ/dt = –10 + t = 0 ⇒ t = 10 s.
A negative value means the truck would have hit the bus before 10 s, so the maximum actual separation is the initial 30 m.
The distance between the truck and the bus is greatest at the instant braking begins; its maximum value is 30 m.
